question.content:
Check out this square pyramid:

[[☃ image 1]]

**Find the surface area of the square pyramid (above) using its net (below).**  



[[☃ image 2]]

[[☃ input-number 1]] units$^2$

options.alt: A square pyramid.  The side of the pyramid's base is 3 units long and the height of the triangular face measured from the center of the side of base to the apex is 4 units.

A net on a coordinate grid.  The net consists of a square and 4 isosceles triangles. The square has a base of 3 units and a height of 3 units. Each triangle has a base of 3 units and a height of 4 units.

hints.content:
$1$ of the faces is a square.

>$\begin{align} \text{Area of a square} &=  \text{side} \cdot \text{side}\\\\
&= 3 \cdot 3\\\\
&= {\blueD{9}} \\\\
\end{align}$

$4$ of the faces are triangles. Each triangle has the same base and height.

>$\begin{align} \text{Area of a triangle} &=  \dfrac12 \cdot \text{base} \cdot \text{height}\\\\
&= \dfrac12 \cdot 3 \cdot 4\\\\
&= 6 \\\\
\end{align}$


The total area of these $4$ triangles is $4 \cdot 6 = \greenD{24}$.

Let's add the areas we found to find the surface area.

>$\begin{align} \text{Surface area} &= \blueD{9}+ \greenD{24}\\\\
&= 33\\\\
\end{align}$
**The surface area of this square pyramid is $33$ units$^2$.**
